subject: RE: [junit] coverage testing
msgSnippet: Sachin, I like to use coverage testing to find holes in my tests (and, by implication, in my testing techniques). If I have a failing test, my software doesn t
messageBody:
Sachin,

I like to use coverage testing to find holes in my tests (and, by
implication, in my testing techniques). If I have a failing test, my
software doesn't work. However, I can have working, stable software without
100% coverage. This is why I use coverage as qualitative, not binary,
feedback.

Sincerely yours,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of sachin.dholakia@...
> Sent: Tuesday, November 15, 2005 10:02 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] coverage testing
>
> Hi J.B,
>
> I am on the other side of the shore and believe in Code
> coverage and so
> very interested in knowing why you feel that 100% code
> coverage isn't a
> requirement for code check in? Can you please share your thoughts?
>
> Thanks & Regards,
> Sachin Dholakia
